intro: Arcoa gonavensis, commonly known as the Gonave beauty, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Gonâve in the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
